intro: Bidens mauiensis, commonly known as Maui ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and dry landscapes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with prominent white markings. Bidens mauiensis plays a vital role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
